• a link
  • another link
  • a special link.
  • a not so special link.
Slide 1
Slide 2
Slide 3

Try to insert any name as a name input in the form to see the amp-form-submit-success event.

Try to insert the word "error" as a name input in the form to see the amp-form-submit-error event.

sections.doc_:
## Introduction

The `amp-analytics` element can be used to measure activity on an AMP document. Currently, `amp-analytics` supports different kinds of events:

* Pageview
* Anchor Clicks
* Timer
* Scrolling
* AMP Carousel changes
* Form

This sample demonstrates which events can be measured and how they can be configured. For a complete overview of all available options and parameters, have a look at the [official documentation](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-analytics-v0.1.md).
sections.cachedMarkedDoc:
Introduction

The amp-analytics element can be used to measure activity on an AMP document. Currently, amp-analytics supports different kinds of events:

  • Pageview
  • Anchor Clicks
  • Timer
  • Scrolling
  • AMP Carousel changes
  • Form

This sample demonstrates which events can be measured and how they can be configured. For a complete overview of all available options and parameters, have a look at the official documentation.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
## Introduction

The `amp-analytics` element can be used to measure activity on an AMP document. Currently, `amp-analytics` supports different kinds of events:

* Pageview
* Anchor Clicks
* Timer
* Scrolling
* AMP Carousel changes
* Form

This sample demonstrates which events can be measured and how they can be configured. For a complete overview of all available options and parameters, have a look at the [official documentation](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-analytics-v0.1.md).

sections.doc_: ## Setup
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Setup

sections.doc_: Import the `amp-analytics` component in the header.
sections.normalizedDoc_: Import the `amp-analytics` component in the header.

sections.code:
<script async custom-element="amp-carousel" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-carousel-0.1.js"></script>
<script async custom-element="amp-bind" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-bind-0.1.js"></script>
<script async custom-element="amp-form" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-form-0.1.js"></script>

sections.doc_: We need `amp-iframe` to embed an analytics dashboard.
sections.normalizedDoc_: We need `amp-iframe` to embed an analytics dashboard.

sections.code:
<link rel="canonical" href="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/components/amp-analytics/index.html">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
<style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
<style amp-custom>
  :root {
    --color-text-light: #fff;
    --space-2: 1rem;  /* 16px */
  }
  .fixed-dashboard {
      background-color: #e0e0e0;
      position: fixed;
      bottom: 0;
      right: 0;
      width: 100%;
      z-index: 100;
      margin: var(--space-2);
      box-shadow:0 1px 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,.14),0 1px 1px -1px rgba(0,0,0,.14),0 1px 5px 0 rgba(0,0,0,.12);
  }
  amp-carousel .slide {
    display: flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    font-size: 20px;
    background: green;
    color: var(--color-text-light);
  }
  </style>
</head>
<body>

<amp-iframe class="fixed-dashboard"
  width="200"
  height="240"
  layout="fixed"
  sandbox="allow-scripts"
  frameborder="0"
  src="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/components/amp-analytics/embed?test=1&user=[= user =]&account=ampdev">
  <amp-img src="/static/samples/img/pixel-white.png"
    layout="fixed-height"
    height="350"
    width="auto"
    placeholder>
  </amp-img>
</amp-iframe>
sections.preview:
<amp-iframe class="fixed-dashboard"
    width="200"
    height="240"
    layout="fixed"
    sandbox="allow-scripts"
    frameborder="0"
    src="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/components/amp-analytics/embed?test=1&user=[= user =]&account=ampdev">
    <amp-img src="/static/samples/img/pixel-white.png"
      layout="fixed-height"
      height="350"
      width="auto"
      placeholder>
    </amp-img>
  </amp-iframe>

sections.doc_: ## Pageview
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Pageview

sections.doc_:
This is a simple `amp-analytics` configuration to fire a single request when the page becomes visible. Note how we declare a variable `eventId` in the request and define the concrete value in the `vars` block.

**Important: ** amp-analytics should be configured in the document body.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
This is a simple `amp-analytics` configuration to fire a single request when the page becomes visible. Note how we declare a variable `eventId` in the request and define the concrete value in the `vars` block.

**Important: ** amp-analytics should be configured in the document body.

sections.doc_: ## UI elements appearance tracking
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## UI elements appearance tracking

sections.doc_: This is a more sophisticated view tracking. This sample fires an analytics request when a specific element becomes visible. The element is specified via `id` and must be an AMP element (amp-img, amp-iframe, amp-ad,...).
sections.normalizedDoc_: This is a more sophisticated view tracking. This sample fires an analytics request when a specific element becomes visible. The element is specified via `id` and must be an AMP element (amp-img, amp-iframe, amp-ad,...).

sections.doc_: This image will trigger an analytics request, if at least 20% of it are visible for 500ms with a minimum time of 200ms continuous visibility.
sections.code:
<amp-img id="cat-image-id"
  src="/static/samples/img/cat-looking-up-300x200.jpg"
  width="300"
  height="200"
  attribution="visualhunt"
  alt="a cat"
  layout="responsive"></amp-img>
sections.preview:
<amp-img id="cat-image-id"
    src="/static/samples/img/cat-looking-up-300x200.jpg"
    width="300"
    height="200"
    attribution="visualhunt"
    alt="a cat"
    layout="responsive"></amp-img>
sections.normalizedDoc_: This image will trigger an analytics request, if at least 20% of it are visible for 500ms with a minimum time of 200ms continuous visibility.

sections.doc_: This sample fires an analytics request when the image becomes visible as a result of an action.
sections.code:
<button on="tap:an-image.toggleVisibility">
  Toggle image
</button>
<amp-img hidden
  id="an-image"
  src="/static/samples/img/amp.jpg"
  width="1080"
  height="610"
  layout="responsive"
  alt="AMP">
</amp-img>
sections.normalizedDoc_: This sample fires an analytics request when the image becomes visible as a result of an action.

sections.doc_: The `elementShown` event is issued when the image becomes visible
sections.normalizedDoc_: The `elementShown` event is issued when the image becomes visible

sections.doc_: ## Anchor click
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Anchor click

sections.doc_: User interactions can be tracked as well. This configuration will track clicks on any anchor links in the page.
sections.normalizedDoc_: User interactions can be tracked as well. This configuration will track clicks on any anchor links in the page.

sections.doc_: Try it by clicking one of the links.
sections.normalizedDoc_: Try it by clicking one of the links.

sections.doc_: It is also possible to fire click events only for specific links. Select specific elements to tracking by specifying a `selector` id. This sample only tracks clicks on anchors with the id `anchor-id`.
sections.normalizedDoc_: It is also possible to fire click events only for specific links. Select specific elements to tracking by specifying a `selector` id. This sample only tracks clicks on anchors with the id `anchor-id`.

sections.doc_: Only one of these links will trigger the `clickOnSpecialAnchor` event.
sections.code:
• a special link.
  • a not so special link.
sections.preview:
• a special link.
  • a not so special link.
sections.normalizedDoc_: Only one of these links will trigger the `clickOnSpecialAnchor` event.

sections.doc_: ## Scroll event
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Scroll event

sections.doc_: Use scroll events to fire a request under certain conditions when the page is scrolled.
sections.normalizedDoc_: Use scroll events to fire a request under certain conditions when the page is scrolled.

sections.doc_: ## Timer
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Timer

sections.doc_: Timer events fire in the specified interval.
sections.normalizedDoc_: Timer events fire in the specified interval.

sections.doc_: ## AMP Carousel Tracking
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## AMP Carousel Tracking

sections.doc_: It is possible to track [amp-carousel](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-carousel-v0.2.md) events with amp-analytics (this works only for  `type="slides"`). Here is a sample carousel:
sections.code:
Slide 1
Slide 2
Slide 3
sections.preview:
Slide 1
Slide 2
Slide 3
sections.normalizedDoc_: It is possible to track [amp-carousel](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-carousel-v0.2.md) events with amp-analytics (this works only for  `type="slides"`). Here is a sample carousel:

sections.doc_: You can use the `fromSlide` and `toSlide` [variables](https://github.com/ampproject/amphtml/blob/master/extensions/amp-analytics/analytics-vars.md) for tracking which slides are viewed. The value is either taken from the `data-slide-id` attribute of the slide when present, else it represents the index of the slide (starting from 0).
sections.normalizedDoc_: You can use the `fromSlide` and `toSlide` [variables](https://github.com/ampproject/amphtml/blob/master/extensions/amp-analytics/analytics-vars.md) for tracking which slides are viewed. The value is either taken from the `data-slide-id` attribute of the slide when present, else it represents the index of the slide (starting from 0).

sections.doc_: The `amp-carousel-change` event is issued when there is any change in the slide that is currently visible:
sections.normalizedDoc_: The `amp-carousel-change` event is issued when there is any change in the slide that is currently visible:

sections.doc_: The `amp-carousel-next` event is issued when there is a traversal to the next slide:
sections.normalizedDoc_: The `amp-carousel-next` event is issued when there is a traversal to the next slide:

sections.doc_: The `amp-carousel-prev` event is issued when there is a traversal to the previous slide:
sections.normalizedDoc_: The `amp-carousel-prev` event is issued when there is a traversal to the previous slide:

sections.doc_: ## Form
sections.normalizedDoc_: ## Form

sections.doc_: You can track events triggered by `amp-form`. Find a list of supported event [here](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-form.md#analytics-triggers).
sections.code:
Try to insert any name as a name input in the form to see the amp-form-submit-success event.

Try to insert the word "error" as a name input in the form to see the amp-form-submit-error event.
sections.preview:
Try to insert any name as a name input in the form to see the amp-form-submit-success event.

Try to insert the word "error" as a name input in the form to see the amp-form-submit-error event.
sections.normalizedDoc_: You can track events triggered by `amp-form`. Find a list of supported event [here](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-form.md#analytics-triggers).

<meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>amp-analytics</title>
  <script async src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0.js"></script>
  <script async custom-element="amp-analytics" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-analytics-0.1.js"></script>
  <script async custom-element="amp-carousel" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-carousel-0.1.js"></script>
  <script async custom-element="amp-bind" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-bind-0.1.js"></script>
  <script async custom-element="amp-form" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-form-0.1.js"></script>
  <script async custom-element="amp-iframe" src="https://cdn.ampproject.org/v0/amp-iframe-0.1.js"></script>
  <link rel="canonical" href="http://localhost:8080/documentation/examples/components/amp-analytics/index.html">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
  <style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
